column4: Principal\rmartin.gutierrez@alisal.org\r-------\rhttps://www.alisal.org/Domain/9\r-\r\r2018-19 School Accountability Report Card\rPublished During the 2019-20 School Year\r\rSchool Description\rBardin Elementary School
column5: home of the "Chieftains" is located at 425 Bardin Road in the city of\r--------\rSalinas.  Our school serves approximately 640 students in grades transitional kindergarten through\rAlisal Union School District\rsixth grade.  The One Way Developmental Bilingual program exists at grades kinder through sixth.\r155 Bardin Road\rWe have a special education day class serving General Academics
column7: CA 93905\rfourth through sixth.  We at Bardin Elementary believe that ALL students are capable learners who (831) 753-5700\rwww.alisal.orghavetherighttoa highqualityeducation
column10: we promote and build connections that integrate students
column14: Vice President\rMuch of the work completed at Bardin has been developed through our partnership with the\r\rMonterey County Office of Education via our Professional Learning Network (PLN). Our leadership\rJosé Antonio Jiménez
column15: Clerk\rteam works together to identify areas of weakness in our practice and highlight the best practices\r\rthat are positively influencing our students outcomes. Through this work we have developed our\rNoemí M. Armenta
column16: Member\rProblem of Practice and school wide implementation classroom read alouds that are strategically\r\rgeared to exposing our students to texts
column17: while addressing their comprehension and writing levels.\rFernando Mercado
column19: all students in grade K-6 participated in 30 minutes of at-level intervention where\r\rstudents were strategically divided by ability and provided with targeted instruction to bridge the\r\rDistrict Administrationlearning gap.\rJames Koenig
column20: Interim\rSuperintendentThe instructional program is comprehensive in all curricular areas based on common core state\rSuperintendentstandards and district guidelines.  Teachers meet on a regular basis to align program content
column22: and student progress through the Grade Level Team (GLT) release model. Our instructional\rAssociate Superintendent
column23: program is supported by Accelerated Reader
column27: and our\rBusiness and Fiscal Servicesbilingual classrooms in grades K-2 use I-Station. In addition
column28: children in grades kindergarten through\rsixth grade  participate in the 1:1 technology program.  Instructional practices include multiple\rMr. Quoc Tranopportunities for technology-based learning projects
column29: in Kinder to second grade students utilize\rAssistant Superintendent
column31: while students in third through sixth utilize Google Classroom.  The\rEducational Services\rgoal is to provide children with the opportunity to learn using the latest educational applications
column32: \r\rwhich support the curriculum.\rMr. Ricardo Cabrera\rAssociate Superintendent
column33: \rThis is the tenth complete year of our after school program. The program offers our students\rHuman Resources\racademicandenrichmentactivities
column37: and math. The enrichment activities include\rDr. Jairo Arellano\rmusic; drum and Ukulele lessons
column38: as well as gardening.  The Reading program includes Lexia
column42: depending on the child's needs.  Math programs include Triumphs
column43: and\rWhole Child Services\rRewards.  The school offers extracurricular activities such as soccer
column46: and flag\r\rfootball.\r\rBardin Elementary school has a strong partnership of staff
column49: and community\rthrough monthly meetings. The encouragement and participation in school activities supports the\ridea that every child can learn and every child will.  ... Unnamed: 5
